subsection_name: mun-trung-ca-o-lung.json_4_Stage of acne formation on the back
subsection_content:
There are 4 stages of back acne formation from mild to severe as follows:
Stage 1: New acne "incipient"
This is the early stage, at this time the number of acne is still small. This stage often appears non-inflammatory acne such as whiteheads/blackheads. If you treat acne right away with this step, the acne will quickly go away and won't leave much of an impact on the skin.
Stage 2: Acne develops at a moderate level
Stage 2 back acne may appear with papules and cysts in addition to blackheads/whiteheads. There may also be redness and inflammation around the acne on the skin. The reasons why acne develops at this stage may be due to poor skin hygiene or squeezing acne when it is still "young".
Stage 3: Acne develops at a serious level
At a serious level, back acne not only causes pain but can also cause inflammation, swelling, and redness in the affected skin area. The number of acne also increases, in some cases the acne covers the back area with many pustules, cysts, and nodules.
